meanings.definition: To give a new form or body to something.
meanings.sent1: She is reembodying her old dress into a new design.
meanings.sent2: The artist is reembodying the sculpture with clay.
meanings.sent3: By reembodying the broken vase, she turned it into a beautiful mosaic.
meanings.sent4: His words reembodying the story brought it to life in a whole new way.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell was like reembodying a dream into reality.

meanings.definition: To bring back into physical form.
meanings.sent1: The scientist is reembodying the extinct species through genetic engineering.
meanings.sent2: Reembodying the ancient artifact, the archaeologist uncovered its true beauty.
meanings.sent3: The chef's recipe was like reembodying a taste from childhood.
meanings.sent4: Her memories reembodying the past made her feel nostalgic.
meanings.sent5: The restoration project was reembodying the historic building to its former glory.

meanings.sent1: After the accident, he is slowly reembodying his confidence.
meanings.sent2: The character in the book is reembodying his courage in the face of danger.
meanings.sent3: Reembodying her love for painting, she picked up the brush once more.
meanings.sent4: The melody reembodying the emotions of the composer resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The dance performance was like reembodying the spirit of the music.
